Articles.Content:
Choose from the three options

Then discuss the three company's
SpaceX. They want to land on Mars, so, yeah.

You should add "Space adventures" to that list.

They're almost like a space tourism company. Almost. They offer tons of flights including semi-space flights and "vomit comet" flights. I don't mean to advertise, but yeah.

There's also a company that I forget the name of that my older brother programs satellites for. So they're my second favorite.
SpaceX. They are working out. Not saying the others aren't, but SpaceX was the first.
Sierra Nevada Corporation. Mainly because they're trying to establish a footing in Earth orbit before they start going for big things like a manned mars landing.
You left out the Russian Federation's Roskosmos. It's not private, but it's the continuation of the most successful space programme, and it continues to do great things.

Never heard of the other two things, so voted SpaceX.

An SSTO could replace the space shuttle!
